bio: A careless Yo-kai who enters battle wearing only a loincloth...and a pan on his head. Try not to take after him so much.

soultimate.name: Pointy Toothpick
soultimate.description: Hit foe with a barrage of hits for lots of damage.

metaDescription: Despite his low rank and status as a near-joke Yo-kai in previous games, Pandle redeems himself in Blasters by abusing one of the strongest strategies in the game: crits. His skill offers an extra 30% crit rate on all his moves with no external support, and his moveset is not shabby either. Mighty Attack is a great offensive option; Dodge lets him survive despite his frailty; and Poke lets him pack just a bit more of a punch when running critical damage effects.

skill.effect: 30% more likely to cause and take critical hits.
skill.name: Careless

name: Pandle

bio: Having abandoned the pan, Undy is pretty much bare to the world. That aside, you won't ever see him wince or bruise.

soultimate.name: Toothpick Rainfall
soultimate.description: Hit foe with a barrage of hits for lots of damage.

metaDescription: Undy is nearly identical to yk#[Tanbo,Tanbo], with the largest difference being their Soultimate Moves. Undy's is a multihit move, which is usually better, but due to their nature as nuke Yo-kai, the faster-charging option with more variance (i.e. yk#[Tanbo,Tanbo]'s) is preferred.

skill.effect: 30% more likely to cause and take critical hits.
skill.name: Careless

name: Undy

bio: A Yo-kai that is always first to the battle! With no clothes to slow him down, he shows up early and always has a nice tan.

soultimate.name: Gutsy Cut
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Tanbo was great in the original Blasters, and he still is in B++. Mighty Attack and a basic offensive soultimate on top of one of the best crit rates without additional support are never tiring, still resulting in the best nuke Yo-kai in the game. Furthermore, he does this all while maintaining a naturally very high general DPS, making him all the more versatile. This is all magnified by the improved supportive options available in B++, making Tanbo even better than he originally was.

skill.effect: 30% more likely to cause and take critical hits.
skill.name: Careless

name: Tanbo

bio: A lazy katana Yo-kai who can drain all of your motivation. He's strangely sharp for being so lazy.

soultimate.name: Halfhearted Chop
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Cutta-nah is a bit of a gimmick —Counter, let alone Mirror Guard, don't deal enough damage to the point where his skill is ever relevant. Nonetheless, Double Slice, Power Attack and Counter are good enough moves to make him an alright attacker.

skill.effect: ↑ the damage of counters and reflects by 30%.
skill.name: Bladed Body

name: Cutta-nah

bio: Too lazy to get a haircut, but not too lazy to slash enemies with his untidy strands.

soultimate.name: Resigned Rush
soultimate.description: Hit foe with a barrage of hits for lots of damage.

metaDescription: Much like Cutta-nah, Cutta-nah-nah's skill doesn't offer much. However, his kit got a significant upgrade upon evolution, turning Power Attack into the much stronger Mighty Attack.

skill.effect: ↑ the damage of counters and reflects by 30%.
skill.name: Bladed Body

name: Cutta-nah-nah

bio: More dangerous than he looks, Slacka-slash can beat his foes with only a single slice.

soultimate.name: Phantom Smash
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Slacka-slash's Extreme Critical is a very strong skill when paired with the right equipment and moves. Double Slice synergizes well with his skill, Mighty Attack is a really strong offensive option, and Counter gives him survivability in the form of evasion.

skill.effect: Criticals deal 75% more damage.
skill.name: Extreme Critical

name: Slacka-slash

bio: A foot soldier who loves cleaning. His spotless reputation means he's sure to be a shogun someday.

soultimate.name: Cleaning Circle
soultimate.description: Allies recover a lot of HP, and Inspirits are removed.

metaDescription: Something healers can struggle with is being able to heal the party often enough due to their moves' cooldowns. Brushido's skill helps combat this while he's healthy, which ends up being quite helpful. Unfortunately, Restore and Purifying! are both rather weak, so Brushido might struggle healing Yo-kai with higher HP stats.

skill.effect: 30% Move Meter speed increase when HP is full.
skill.name: Washed Out

name: Brushido

bio: A neat-freak shogun who has been known to make heads roll if an underling so much as smudges his helmet.

soultimate.name: Spray Care
soultimate.description: Allies recover a lot of HP, and Inspirits are removed.

metaDescription: Washogun follows the same principle as yk#[Brushido,Brushido], but compensates his healing power issue with the addition of Paradise over Restore.

skill.effect: 30% Move Meter speed increase when HP is full.
skill.name: Washed Out

name: Washogun

bio: A laid-back lion who wants to be a mighty warrior but tends to prioritize nap time over sword practice.

soultimate.name: Paws 'n' Claws
soultimate.description: Hit foe with a barrage of hits for lots of damage.

metaDescription: Lie-in is a fairly basic physical attacker, with fundamentally good moves and a skill that, while not extraordinary, is still useful —especially with the buffs B++ has given to it

skill.effect: 10% Atk 70% Def 8% Spd 20% MM ↑ 1 min into mission.
skill.name: Slow Starter

name: Lie-in

bio: A lion who's realized his full potential. He always waits for the perfect moment before striking.

soultimate.name: Lion Blade
soultimate.description: Hit foe with a barrage of hits for lots of damage.

metaDescription: Lie-in-Heart has great offensive options in Triple Attack and Mighty Attack and a good enough skill. Before B++, he desperately needed evasion, but the addition of Sidestep has solved that. Overall, a really solid Yo-kai. eq#[Oni Smasher (Sky),Oni Smasher (Sky)]

skill.effect: 10% Atk 70% Def 8% Spd 20% MM ↑ 1 min into mission.
skill.name: Lie-in Wait

name: Lie-in Heart

bio: This foul-tempered fellow stamps his feet constantly, making it hard to take him seriously.

soultimate.name: Angry Cross Cut
soultimate.description: Hit foe with a barrage of hits for lots of damage.

skill.effect: Atk ↑ when attacked, 2% ↑ per hit, lasts till death.
skill.name: That All You Got?

name: Hissfit

bio: Legend has it that this Yo-kai leveled an entire village with one tantrum. You'll explode with rage if he's around.

soultimate.name: Zerberker Slash
soultimate.description: Hit foe with a barrage of hits for lots of damage.

skill.effect: Atk ↑ when attacked, 2% ↑ per hit, lasts till death.
skill.name: That All You Got?

name: Zerberker

bio: This Yo-kai visits homes asking, "Any brats here?" It's a way of scaring kids into behaving well. Kind of like a reverse Santa.

soultimate.name: For Naughty Brats
soultimate.description: Hit foe with a barrage of hits for lots of damage.

metaDescription: Snartle has a *great* skill in Seeing Red —the main reason yk#[Shogunyan,Shogunyan] is so good. His lack of reliable evasion is still somewhat of an issue, but Snartle works so well with attack drop combos that it doesn't matter so much. In particular, a team of 4 Snartles, all with the standard build of eq#[Moon Shadow,Moon Shadow] and sl#[Swirlious Omai Soul,Swirlious Omai Soul] or sl#[Red Paws Soul,Red Paws Soul], each carrying a force blaster of any rank (to use immediately at the start of the fight) will obliterate any boss in the game. This composition can also be adjusted to include other Yo-kai such as Intimidatete users to help build combo faster or yk#[Insomni,Insomni] to drop the foe's defense to 0 (which eq#[Moon Shadow,Moon Shadow] cannot do on its own) while also helping the Snartles stay alive longer.

skill.effect: Atk ↑ when attacking, 1% ↑ per hit, lasts 5 seconds.
skill.name: Seeing Red

name: Snartle

bio: He's cute most of the time, but when he's mad, his body cracks and his manly face pops out.

soultimate.name: Mochi Punch
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Mochismo's moveset is rather weak for what he's supposed to do —he doesn't have strong attacking options or defensive moves—, and his skill is not all that impactful either, given how boss moves usually have a much lower crit rate than regular moves.

skill.effect: Immune to criticals.
skill.name: Gooey Guard

name: Mochismo

bio: When he's in love, he gets overly protective of his partner. He can make you a very jealous person.

soultimate.name: Minochi Punch
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Minochi is identical to yk#[Mochismo,Mochismo] save for the fact that his skill is worse. Adding 7.5% to an offensive stat just doesn't do very much to make your damage output reasonable.

skill.effect: Attack increases with higher Defense.
skill.name: Elasticity

name: Minochi

bio: There's nothing he won't lick—the ickier the better! Don't get Inspirited by Tublappa if you value a clean tongue.

soultimate.name: Lickety-Lick
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Tublappa's offensive options are rather middling, especially given the lack of evasion in his kit. His skill can be pretty good, but is too situational to make him remarkable.

skill.effect: 10% Atk 70% Def 8% Spd 20% MM ↑ when Inspirited ↓.
skill.name: Contrarian

name: Tublappa

bio: With this Yo-kai, it is best to follow a slight twist on an old saying: "Let sleeping hogs lie."

soultimate.name: Snooze Bruiser
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Thanks to Sturdy Inspirit, Guard and Rice Ball, Slumberhog has some respectable survivability, which is increased by his skill that makes him easier to heal (though it doesn't affect Rice Ball). In particular, Sturdy Inspirit offers very significant defensive support for the team, which boosts his ranking by a ton. Offensively, Body Press is good, but not remarkable nor enough to make him an outstanding damage dealer.

skill.effect: Heals 50% more of own HP.
skill.name: Really Healy

name: Slumberhog

bio: Someone made the mistake of wakin' the bacon, and he's absolutely furious about it!

soultimate.name: Hog Wild
soultimate.description: Hit foe with a barrage of hits for lots of damage.

metaDescription: Snortlehog has had the biggest glow-up we've seen so far in ++ —going from nigh worthless to an extremely strong Yo-kai. He fills a similar role to yk#[Tanbo,Tanbo], with the perfect toolkit for nukes thank to his skill, Mighty Attack and Big Attack Boost. However, he's less versatile than yk#[Tanbo,Tanbo] due to the lack of evasion and weaker crit rate when factoring equipment.

skill.effect: Criticals deal 75% more damage.
skill.name: Extreme Critical

name: Snortlehog

bio: A warrior who aims to be the best in the world, he excels at giving enemies the slip.

soultimate.name: Eelergetic
soultimate.inspiritEffects: Increases ally Attack by 30% for 20 seconds.
soultimate.description: Nearby allies' attack power boosted for a time.

metaDescription: In a vacuum, Samureel is actually better in B++ than in vanilla thanks to the increased Soul Meter charge of Bring It On —and he's still an undoubtedly great support Yo-kai thanks to his Soultimate Move and Disarmament. That said, the existence of yk#[DON-CHAN,DON-CHAN] makes Samureel's positive inspirits a bit less valuable. Likewise, thanks to sl#[McKraken Soul,McKraken Soul], pairing his Disarmament with another defense debuffer reaches the defense drop cap more easily, making the drops go to waste. Samureel is still a great support Yo-kai, just a bit harmed by the B++ environment.

skill.effect: Stamina does not decrease for all allies.
skill.name: Keep on Runnin'

name: Samureel

bio: This evolved Samureel is so powerful that no one is willing to take him on in battle.

soultimate.name: Bored Slice
soultimate.description: Hit foe with a barrage of hits for lots of damage.

metaDescription: Time Keeler is a solid bulky attacker that leverages his tank debuff moves to deal more damage and support the team. His skill, while not bad, isn't too impactful either, and his main limiting factors come from having Discouragement instead of its upgraded version and only having Attack as his A move.

skill.effect: Stamina does not decrease for all allies.
skill.name: Keep on Runnin'

name: Time Keeler

bio: Strength: defeating Oni in battle. Weakness: being eaten by Hungramps.

soultimate.name: Onigiri Slash
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Slicenrice is much like his evolution, yk#[Flamurice,Flamurice], but with fewer offensive options and worse stats.

skill.effect: Boosts damage to Oni-type foes by 15% for all allies.
skill.name: Rice and Dice

name: Slicenrice

bio: A smokin'-hot, next-level rice warrior. His tough, crispy skin makes him pretty unappealing to Hungramps.

soultimate.name: Toasted Slash
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Flamurice has a solid offensive movekit, but his main draw is his utility against oni foes. Granting a 15% damage boost alone, he's able to enable massive multipliers against oni if properly built around.

skill.effect: Boosts damage to Oni-type foes by 15% for all allies.
skill.name: Rice and Dice

name: Flamurice

bio: A floating helmet that was worn by a famous military commander. He spends his days searching for his body—a good use of time.

soultimate.name: Helmsman Helm
soultimate.inspiritEffects: Increases own Defense by 350% for 30 seconds
soultimate.description: Defense greatly increased, and foes focus on you.

metaDescription: Helmsman is somewhat similar to his evolution, yk#[Reuknight,Reuknight], in that he balances offense and defensive support in his kit. Nonetheless, his options on both ends are much weaker, making him deal a lot less damage while being less safe and offering worse support.

skill.effect: Soul Meter increases when guarding foe’s attack.
skill.name: Guardian Spirit

name: Helmsman

bio: Helmsman and Armsman reunited. He now aspires to do what he couldn't do when he was alive— unify the country.

soultimate.name: Knight's Slash
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Reuknight has good options for both offense and defensive support. Stab Storm, paired with Dbl. Disarmament and Mighty Attack let him dish out solid damage, while Sturdy Circle and Iron Guard are both good at keeping himself —and the team— alive. His skill also helps him in the offense department by charging his Soul Meter when he guards —something he wants to do often. Overall, Reuknight is a very solid Yo-kai that can dish out respectable damage while keeping himself and the team healthy.

skill.effect: Soul Meter increases when guarding foe’s attack.
skill.name: Guardian Spirit

name: Reuknight

bio: A crony of Mckraken. It was promised unification across The Yo-kai World in Mckraken’s political rallies.

soultimate.name: Knight's Slash
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: White Reuknight is one of the best Stab Storm abusers thanks to his skill, which greatly benefits from the multihit aspect of the move. Mighty Attack serves as a very strong option to use when you have a combo built up, and he has access to reliable evasion in the form of Sidestep and the buffed Counter. Overall a very strong combo Yo-kai, similar to others such as yk#[Snartle,Snartle] but considerably more aggressive.

skill.effect: Atk ↑ when attacking, 1% ↑ per hit, lasts 5 seconds.
skill.name: Seeing Red

name: Reuknight

bio: A popular leader when he was alive, Corptain leads an army of souls even after death. Now that's charisma!

soultimate.name: Ticket to Hades
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Corptain is a very strong user of the tank debuff moves, having a natural synergy with his skill increasing damage to inspirited foes. Alongside that, he's able to charge his strong soultimate fast to capitalize off the damage buff.

skill.effect: ↑ damage to Negatively Inspirited foes by 25%.
skill.name: Merciless

name: Corptain

bio: This Yo-kai embodies the pain of farmers who have lost their fields. He's easy to identify thanks to his moan, "Get off my land!"

soultimate.name: Dirty Trick
soultimate.inspiritEffects: Drops foe's Attack by 30% for 20 seconds.
soultimate.description: Attack to decrease foes' attack power for a time.

metaDescription: Mudmunch just doesn't really have a great kit —he has no offensive presence, and his defensive options don't help the team all that much. His skill is also too situational to be actually good, so Mudmunch ends up being a very middling Yo-kai overall.

skill.effect: 10% Atk 70% Def 8% Spd 20% MM ↑ when Inspirited ↓.
skill.name: Cursed Skin

name: Mudmunch

bio: A Yo-criminal who’s been on the down-low in Harrisville since the distant past. He’s a glutton for soda and leaves cans around the rice paddies.

soultimate.name: Fizzical Finesse
soultimate.inspiritEffects: Drops foe's Attack by 30% for 20 seconds.
soultimate.description: Attack to decrease foes' attack power for a time.

metaDescription: Despite the variety of tools in his kit, Sud Munch is best used as a mage (Trap and Mine aren't great, and standalone Power Attack isn't either), and he's not a terrible one either. His skill is helpful, though less so than if he were a physical attacker. That said, with only Splash and Rapids for offensive options, he won't be putting in as much work as oter mages might.

skill.effect: 30% Move Meter speed increase when HP is full.
skill.name: Washed Out

name: Sud Munch

bio: The much-loved boss of Burly's Beat Camp doesn't go easy on folks he trains. He's there to pump you up, after all!

soultimate.name: Victoryyyyyyyy!
soultimate.inspiritEffects: Increases ally Attack by 15%, Defense by 105%, movement speed by 12% and Move Meter speed by 30% for 20 seconds.
soultimate.description: All nearby allies' stats are boosted for a time.

metaDescription: Sgt. Burly boasts a great skill to support the team (and himself), further enhanced by his Soultimate Move. In terms of Moves, Mighty Attack and Dodge let him deal considerable damage safely, making him something other than a sitting duck. Attack, while not the best A move out there, gets the job more than done as well.

skill.effect: All allies' Strength up by 5%.
skill.name: Beat Camp

name: Sgt. Burly

bio: The king of beasts with a mane of fire! This hot- blooded Yo-kai fills folks with fiery enthusiasm.

soultimate.name: Blazing Fist
soultimate.description: Burn foes for lots of damage.

metaDescription: Blazion has a passable moveset for an attacker in Attack, Blitz Attack and Dodge. On its own, it'd make him nothing more than a mediocre physical attacker, but he can take advantage of his skill to apply Equipment and Souls that increase the power of Fire attacks. Thanks to this, Blazion can be a much better damage dealer than he would have been otherwise.

skill.effect: Adds Fire Element to attacks.
skill.name: Fan the Flames

name: Blazion

bio: Every step Quaken takes shakes the place...and some of those vibrations can even move your heart. Awwwwww!

soultimate.name: Earthshaker
soultimate.description: Massive rocks fall and deal lots of damage to foes.

metaDescription: Much like yk#[Blazion,Blazion], Quaken abuses his skill to make his otherwise mediocre kit a lot more threatening —this time around, using Earth attacks.

skill.effect: Adds Earth Element to attacks.
skill.name: Quaker Maker

name: Quaken

bio: Siro brings out the best in those he Inspirits. They become shining lights for the future.

soultimate.name: Roaring Stance
soultimate.inspiritEffects: Increases ally Attack by 30% for 20 seconds.
soultimate.description: Nearby allies' attack power boosted for a time.

metaDescription: Attack, Blitz Attack and Dodge are all good enough moves for a physical attacker, but Siro's main draw is his incredible Soultimate Move, greatly increasing his and the team's damage output. Overall, he ends up being a good enough attacker with the option to support the team every once in a while.

skill.effect: Increases damage to foes in danger.
skill.name: Knockout Blow

name: Siro

bio: Once a proud warrior, Chansin threw it all away by gambling... Now his best odds are to retreat.

soultimate.name: Go for Broke
soultimate.inspiritEffects: Increases ally Attack by 30% for 20 seconds.
soultimate.description: Nearby allies' attack power boosted for a time.

metaDescription: Chansin is an interesting mixture of an offensive and a supportive Yo-kai that, nontheless (as should be evident by his tier!) works really well. With what may be the best offensive skill in the game and a very synergetic moveset, he has no issue dealing damage. His Soultimate Move only helps improve that for himself and the whole team.

skill.effect: 30% more likely to cause and take critical hits.
skill.name: Gambler

name: Chansin

bio: A infamous Yo-criminal with terrible luck. He’s on the run for using a dice with all sixes and folding edges to cheat at cards.

soultimate.name: Bluff 'n' Tumble
soultimate.inspiritEffects: Increases ally Attack by 30% for 20 seconds.
soultimate.description: Nearby allies' attack power boosted for a time.

metaDescription: Chaninverse acts as a more defensive, supportive counterpart to yk#[Chansin,Chansin]'s frailty. His skill limits his damage output significantly, but offers some defensive utility. Chaninverse can abuse this and his good natural bulk to act as a bulky attacker that specializes in boosting allies with his Soultimate Move while dishing out consistent damage.

skill.effect: Won't take critical hits, but can't land them either.
skill.name: Safe Bet

name: Chaninverse

bio: A Yo-kai swordsman who returned to the way of the sword when a legendary blade reignited his spirit.

soultimate.name: Legendary Blade
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Triple Attack, Dash Attack, Fall Back Attack, and Light Speed are a really strong combo, though Sheen's long A attack animation make yk#[Hovernyan,Hovernyan] —who has the same options— a bit safer.

skill.effect: 20% more likely to cause criticals.
skill.name: Light Speed

name: Sheen

bio: This Yo-criminal is a prankster swordsman who insists toilet paper should only be cut by his signature sword. It’s annoying for everyone but him.

soultimate.name: Blunt Blade
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Shin's movekit is extremely strong, and his stats are so high that, even accounting for Equipment, he can have a significantly higher STR than other Yo-kai, all while maintaining a solid bulk. This comes at the cost of a detrimental skill that locks one of the strongest strategies away from him. Furthermore, his skill means he has more trouble than other Yo-kai synergizing with Equipment skills and Souls. In the end, Shin ends up as a solid attacker that can struggle fitting into very specialized teams.

skill.effect: Can't cause critical hits.
skill.name: Dull Edge

name: Shin

bio: Cursed by his demon blade, Snee searches the world for blood. He excels at silently sneaking up on his enemies.

soultimate.name: Demonic Slash
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

skill.effect: Absorbs 10% of the damage dealt.
skill.name: Vampiric

name: Snee

bio: A holy swordsman with a divine blade that cuts through evil like cheddar cheese. Could he bring about tasty world peace?

soultimate.name: Holy Blade
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Gleam is very close to yk#[Sheen,Sheen], only deviating in skill with Extreme Critical over Light Speed. Although in most cases the difference is meaningless, with Gleam just needing to run a crit rate soul rather than a crit damage soul, you can fully invest in crit damage with yk#[Whisper,Whisper] support to deal even heavier damage with criticals.

skill.effect: Criticals deal 75% more damage.
skill.name: Extreme Critical

name: Gleam

bio: Hiding 999 weapons from fallen foes in his stomach, Benkei can call any one of them out in a moment of need.

soultimate.name: 999 Blades
soultimate.description: Hit foe with a barrage of hits for lots of damage.

skill.effect: 25% Atk ↑ for 20 seconds after defeating foes.
skill.name: Sword Hunting

name: Benkei

bio: A Yo-kai whose body is half machine. He could very well be the world's first cyborg Yo-kai.

soultimate.name: B3-NK1 GUN
soultimate.description: Hit foe with a barrage of hits for lots of damage.

skill.effect: 25% Atk ↑ for 20 seconds after defeating foes.
skill.name: Sword Hunting

name: B3-NK1

bio: This champion of justice crushed countless evils via the purity of his heart. He was a normal boy who loved superheroes...a lot.

soultimate.name: Mighty Moxie
soultimate.inspiritEffects: Increases own Attack by 25%, Defense by 175%, movement speed by 20% and Move Meter speed by 50% for 30 seconds.
soultimate.description: Recover all HP and all stats are greatly increased.

skill.effect: Evasion will avoid foes' attacks more easily.
skill.name: Quick Reflexes

name: Moximous N

bio: He was a boy who loved Yo-kai so much that he became one himself. That love still spreads through hundreds of Yo-kai friends.

soultimate.name: Mega Moxie
soultimate.inspiritEffects: Increases own Attack by 25%, Defense by 175%, movement speed by 20% and Move Meter speed by 50% for 30 seconds.
soultimate.description: Recover all HP and all stats are greatly increased.

skill.effect: Evasion will avoid foes' attacks more easily.
skill.name: Quick Reflexes

name: Moximous K

bio: Despite being able to float, Hovernyan's very down to earth. His forehead scar reminds him of his fallibility.

soultimate.name: Gutsy Cross Paw
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Wields a strong combo of Dash Attack, Fall Back Attack, and Light Speed, which, alongside his fast speed, make for a safe, potent attacker. Hovernyan also has access to Big Attack Boost, which can help support the team at the cost of his own damage output.

skill.effect: 20% more likely to cause criticals.
skill.name: Light Speed

name: Hovernyan

bio: Machonyan's mask hides the scars he suffered during his time as a wrestler-in-training.

soultimate.name: Tiger Meow
soultimate.description: Swoop to deal damage. Hurt self in the process.

skill.effect: Will hold HP at 1 twice, even if HP falls to 0.
skill.name: Purrsistence

name: Machonyan

bio: A Yo-kai who desperately wants to be Japanese. He sleeps on a futon and eats only sushi. I think he might be doing it wrong...

soultimate.name: Sushiyama Strike
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

skill.effect: Increases the power of X button moves by 40%.
skill.name: The X-Factor

name: Sushiyama

bio: A punk Yo-kai who wears kabuki-style makeup. He dreams of rocking the socks and faces off his fans all across the globe.

soultimate.name: Boastful Bomber
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

metaDescription: Kapunki has a solid kit in Triple Attack, Mighty Attack, and Dodge, with a basic 400 BP soultimate. While his skill doesn't do anything for him offensively, it serves as a built-in getaway plush, making Kapunki a fairly safe option for how much DPS his kit allows him. Nothing broken, but no joke either.

skill.effect: When HP falls to 0, will recover once only, at 1 HP.
skill.name: Grit

name: Kapunki

bio: A crony of Mckraken. It was promised connections with his adoring fans in Mckraken’s political rallies.

soultimate.name: Boastful Bomber
soultimate.description: Deal massive damage to foes nearby.

skill.effect: Move Meter charges 16% faster.
skill.name: Spin to Win

name: Kapunki

bio: Beetler is a young battler who fights with his horns and his fists. He trains with his rival, Rhinoggin.

soultimate.name: Big Pincers
soultimate.description: Frontal assault dealing massive damage to foes.

metaDescription: Beetler is a very potent attacker that intentionally goes to low health and uses his skill to dish out big damage. Mighty Attack in particular s a great offensive option for the role. Prior to B++, he struggled with survivability due to his lack of evasion (pre-buff Invincible Stance does not count) and only having access to Attack as an A move. Now, he has One-Two Punch, which is a lot safer since it can be cancelled into the evasive option of Sidestep.

skill.effect: Attack up by 30% when below 25% HP.

metaDescription: Cheatler's skill, when paired with Equipment items and Souls that make his Soul Meter charge faster, lets him use very strong Soultimate Moves all the time. Thanks to this and his moveset with solid offensive options and reliable evasion, Cheatler ends up being a very solid attacker with good synergy with Yo-kai such as yk#[Smogmella,Smogmella].

metaDescription: Frostail was one of the best mages in vanilla Blasters, but that's not saying much. In B++, however, mages are good, and Frostail kept all his good traits and improved on them. Frostail's main draw is his skill, as his main damage output comes from his techniques —namely Blizzard. Thanks to it, he's stuck charging them for less time, meaning he can use them more often and has more time to dodge, use his A Move or even charge a different technique. In practice, this means Frostail deals significantly more damage and is a lot safer than if he didn't have the skill —and due to the way they stack, it only becomes better when paired with a sl#[Robonyan 28 Soul,Robonyan 28 Soul].

metaDescription: Usually, it's really hard for a healer to both keep the team healthy and deal any significant damage, but Unikirin makes a storng case otherwise. In terms of damage output, he has the same good traits as yk#[Frostail,Frostail], but his skill is also good for healing, as it helps shave off some time he'd have to dedicate to his healing moves as well, meaning he can heal more often. With that in mind, if he runs an offensive technique, he's still only able to use one healing move, which will still make him less reliable as a healer than other options. Likewise, he won't be able to have fast revival and sl#[Robonyan 28 Soul,Robonyan 28 Soul] on his Soul slot at the same time.

skill.effect: Techniques take 30% less time to charge.
skill.name: Horn Power

metaDescription: Neighfarious is undoubtedly the most potent defense debuffer in the game. Disarmament and Bring it On, combined with an equipment item that boosts Soul Meter charge, allow this dark horse to keep the enemy's defense dropped for most —if not all— of any fight you bring him in. In B++, while he wasn't directly buffed, the presence of eq#[Venoct Gauntlet,Venoct Gauntlet] and reworked sl#[McKraken Soul,McKraken Soul], as well as Bring It On's improved Soul Meter charge all let the horse be even more effective at his role than he already was.

skill.name: Cursed Skin

metaDescription: Prior to B++, Everfore was relegated to an Oni-Orb-Hunt-only Yo-kai —her kit was no good for regular fights. Now, however, she has the tools to dish out damage, but, more importantly, to offer proper support outside of orb hunts. Hassle has really strong synergy with both Multi Drop Inspirit and Void, so she can either sit back and help allies with these two moves or jump into the action with Reaper. Lastly, Big Speed Drop is still a great option for Oni Orb Hunt.

metaDescription: Venoct has been regarded since the release of Blasters as one of the strongest Yo-kai in the game thanks to his access to guaranteed crits and solid moveset. However, his strength of guaranteed crits thanks to Vanishing Act is also a weakness when compared to other crit attackers, as he'll usually want to run both Vanishing Act and Fall Back Attack for evasion. This leaves him without a strong secondary offensive option, which severely harms his damage output. That said, that's mitigated by the existence of yk#[Nul,Nul] Fields and, in B++, Vanishing Inspirit from allies. Overall, Venoct is still an incredibly strong attacker, but not as flexible as other crit attackers if you want to reach his full potential.

On the flipside, this power is enabled by Fiend Skill, which takes up a move slot Toadal Demon could otherwise use to dish out more damage. metaDescription: Friend-form Captain Thunder adapts his tools from the boss fight into a playable Yo-kai's style. True to his Lunar mode fight, he has the strong Sniper skill, letting him attack from afar with his A move and Charge Shot. Post-buff Invincible Stance serves as alright evasion, especially given how ranged attackers are inherently safer. Charge Attack is a fine offensive option, but his skill doesn't take advantage of it. Likewise, Sparking Shock is a great move, but his kit is not the best suited for it. Overall, Captain Thunder isn't a bad ranged attacker, but he can't abuse all his options optimally. He's very fun to play, though!

skill.effect: 50% more likely to crit at max dist, doesn't stack.

His kit affords him two very powerful offensive options in Godswave and Gratitude Beam, alongside a strong evasive option in Mysterious Barrier that can shield himself and his allies. On top of that, his Soultimate Move furthers his power while letting him survive for a very long time, even without support.

This alone is good, but he also has the ability to heal off any damage taken, should he dedicate a moveslot for it. Otherwise, he has Mighty Attack and Aerial Slash to put out good damage, plus Defensive Stance to take hits better.

On the bad side, he's a bit clunky, with long animations and no equipment freedom. That said, he's naturally both very bulky and very strong, which is further enhanced by his equipped soul. Overall, he's a solid Yo-kai that might take some getting used to.

metaDescription: Overdrive is, simply put, very strong. Moreover, Ult. Robonyan is quite good at abusing the skill thanks to Triple Attack and Blitz Attack. Invincible Stance in B++ is also quite reliable in terms of evasion, especially so with the reduced cooldown of Overdrive.

skill.effect: MM Spd ↑ when attacking, 2% ↑ per hit, lasts 4 sec.
skill.name: Overdrive

name: Ult. Robonyan

bio: A sheltered girl who always has the headmaster's affection. After a certain incident, she developed feelings for Jinpei.

soultimate.name: Supreme Emma Blast
soultimate.inspiritEffects: Increases ally Attack by 15%, Defense by 105%, movement speed by 12% and Move Meter speed by 30% for 20 seconds.
soultimate.description: Fires a giant blast, then boosts the team's stats.

metaDescription: Emma offers a very interesting mix between offense (and mixed offense, at that) and support, while pulling it all off surprisingly well. Her moveset lets her deal solid damage with both Mighty Attack and Emma Orb, and her skill can combo very nicely with other similar skills. This skill is what ties her otherwise "just alright" kit together: thanks to it, the boosts from Multi Boost Inspirit and her Soultimate Move become significantly more impactful, and Invincible Stance becomes much more reliable thanks to the increased length. Overall, she pairs really well with other Yo-kai with her same skill, such as herself, yk#[Duke Doggy,Duke Doggy] or yk#[Gemble,Gemble].

skill.effect: Positive Inspirit effects last 20% longer for allies.
skill.name: Extra Mile

name: Emma
